com.extensia.xcp.services.restapi.client

Class BaseServiceApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.extensia.xcp.services.restapi.client.BaseServiceApi
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeviceApi, JobApi, OrganizationApi, ProductionProfileApi

    public abstract class BaseServiceApi
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class defining the base methods for server API classes. The class includes parameterized methods for processing REST requests and handling server response errors.

      • createWebTarget

        public javax.ws.rs.client.WebTarget createWebTarget(java.lang.String... requestPath)
        Creates and initializes a JAX-RS web target with the specified REST service request path.
        Parameters:
        requestPath - REST request path
        Returns:
        Configured web target

      • executeRequest

        protected <T> T executeRequest(javax.ws.rs.client.WebTarget webTarget,
                               java.lang.Class<T> resultType,
                               java.lang.String apiVersion,
                               java.lang.String message)
        Parametrized method for performing a server REST request. The method calls the server API and interprets the server response. On success, the server response is deserialized and returned as an instance of the specified result type. On error, an exception is thrown with the available error details.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type parameter for the response
        Parameters:
        webTarget - Web target to use for the request
        resultType - Class type for the response
        apiVersion - Server API version level to use
        message - Error message to use if the REST request fails
        Returns:
        Response object
        Throws:
        CardServicesApiException - if a server error occurs
        CardServicesException - if response deserialization fails

      • postRequest

        protected <T> T postRequest(javax.ws.rs.client.WebTarget webTarget,
                            javax.ws.rs.client.Entity<?> requestEntity,
                            javax.ws.rs.core.GenericType<ResponseWrapper<T>> resultType,
                            java.lang.String apiVersion,
                            java.lang.String message)
        Parametrized method for performing a server POST request. The method posts the specified entity to server and interprets the server response. On success, the server response is deserialized and returned as an instance of the specified result type. On error, an exception is thrown with the available error details.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type parameter for the response
        Parameters:
        webTarget - Web target to use for the request
        requestEntity - Entity to post to the server
        resultType - Class type for the response
        apiVersion - Server API version level to use
        message - Error message to use if the REST request fails
        Returns:
        Response object
        Throws:
        CardServicesApiException - if a server error occurs
        CardServicesException - if response deserialization fails

      • buildResponseType

        protected static <T> javax.ws.rs.core.GenericType<ResponseWrapper<T>> buildResponseType(java.lang.Class<T> resultType)
        Constructs the GenericType needed to deserialize a ResponseWrapper of the specified result type. The generic type is used to workaround Java type erasure and allow the Jersey client to properly deserialize the server JSON responses.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type parameter for the response
        Parameters:
        resultType - Class type for the response list
        Returns:
        Generic type instance

        Parameters:

      • createException

        protected CardServicesApiException createException(javax.ws.rs.core.Response response,
                                                   java.lang.String message)
        Creates and returns a CardServicesApiException for the given server error response. The exception is created from the JSON formatted error information provided by the server if available. The HTTP status code and provided message are used as a fallback when the server response does not contain a json error response.
        Parameters:
        response - REST method response
        message - Fallback error message
        Returns:
        New exception instance
